data.title: Lucas Bryant, Bruce Davison and Michelle Hurd to headline 25 Miles to Normal
data.meta_description: The film will begin shooting this month in Kansas City and St. Joseph, Missouri
data.text:
Lucas Bryant, Bruce Davison and Michelle Hurd are set to star in the upcoming film 25 Miles to Normal. Touted to be a family-centric comedy film, it will be helmed by writer-director Joshua Brandon.

25 Miles to Normal is a story that revolves around a doctor (Bryant) and his estranged father (Davison) as they unwillingly agree to reunite with the rest of their family. The film will begin shooting this month in Kansas City and St. Joseph, Missouri. Apart from Lucas Bryant, Bruce Davison and Michelle Hurd, 25 Miles to Normal also stars Rachel Nichols, Ed Begley Jr. and Dee Wallace in prominent roles.

Along with Peter Foldy's Filmstreet Productions and B.L. Fleischer for RcR Cinema, Brandon will produce under the Spitfire Cinema label.

Lucas Bryant is a Canadian-American actor, who is known for his works in Crazy Canucks, An American in Canada and The Eleventh Hour. Bryant starred as Calvin Puddie in the TV movie Playing House based on the book by Patricia Pearson. Bryant had supporting roles in the movies A Very Merry Daughter of the Bride and The Vow. In 2010, Bryant landed a lead role as Nathan in Haven, a TV series based on Stephen King's novel The Colorado Kid.
